pullRequest.body:
Co-authored by: Josha Dekker

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

This is mostly extracted from #12394

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [e4d51fc0d7](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21955/commits/e4d51fc0d7e85822e4b268595fd810bd290c9c76)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Measure.Tight` (new file)|1391|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsTightMeasureSet`
`+ IsTightMeasureSet_iff_exists_isCompact_measure_compl_le`
`+ inter`
`+ isTightMeasureSet_singleton_of_innerRegular`
`+ isTightMeasureSet_singleton_of_innerRegularWRT`
`+ of_compactSpace`
`+ subset`
`+ union`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
How does this relate to #19780, which proved that probability measures on Polish spaces are tight, but without using the word tight?

Indeed the other PR proved this:
```lean
theorem PolishSpace.innerRegular_isCompact_isClosed_measurableSet [TopologicalSpace Î±]
    [PolishSpace Î±] [BorelSpace Î±] (P : Measure Î±) [IsFiniteMeasure P] :
    P.InnerRegularWRT (fun s â†¦ IsCompact s âˆ§ IsClosed s) MeasurableSet
```
The last result of this PR proves
```lean
instance [T2Space Î±] [OpensMeasurableSpace Î±] [IsFiniteMeasure Î¼] [Î¼.InnerRegular] : IsTight Î¼
```
And I just remembered that the `T2Space` argument is only there to ensure that compact sets are closed. The better statement should be
```lean
theorem isTight_of_innerRegularWRT [OpensMeasurableSpace Î±] [IsFiniteMeasure Î¼]
    (h : Î¼.InnerRegularWRT (fun s â†¦ IsCompact s âˆ§ IsClosed s) MeasurableSet) :
    IsTight Î¼
```

I guess a question is whether we need a new definition for a tight measure (tight sets of measures we definitely want). It's not clear to me if there are settings where the definition IsTight is different from some form of InnerRegular and the tight measure property is interesting.

If I'm not mistaken, tightness always implies `innerRegularWRT IsCompact IsClosed`, and the converse is true for ~~Ïƒ-finite~~ finite measures. I don't think it will be possible to get a version for any measure though, but I think this is not really needed. From my limited experience with tightness what we want is either a tight set of measures for results about the topology over measures or a tight indexed family for some convergence results. I don't think tightness of a single measure is really worth adding. Maybe we can add in the doc that this case is most of the time covered by `innerRegularWRT`.
I removed `IsTight`. The file is now only about `IsTightMeasureSet`.

This seems fine to me, thanks!
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by EtienneC30.

bors r+
Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13524342460/job/37790987821)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13524342460/job/37790987184)
So here the `MeasurableSpace` argument should be made implicit right?
Yes it should. I missed that when copying the code from the other PR. Thanks!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: define tight sets of measures
